intro: Sturtia, commonly known as the common sturtia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal or sandy soils. Sturtia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. It plays a role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insects and birds.
